member.name: T:algorithms.AATree
member.summary: Implements an AA-tree. Note that all "matching" is based on the compareTo method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss

member.name: P:algorithms.AATree.Empty
member.summary: Test if the tree is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.insert(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Insert into the tree. Does nothing if x is already present.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.remove(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Remove from the tree. Does nothing if x is not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.findMin
member.summary: Find the smallest item in the tree.
member.returns: the smallest item or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.findMax
member.summary: Find the largest item in the tree.
member.returns: the largest item or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.find(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Find an item in the tree.
member.returns: the matching item of null if not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the tree logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.printTree
member.summary: Print the tree contents in sorted order.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.insert(algorithms.Comparable,algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Internal method to insert into a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: the new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.remove(algorithms.Comparable,algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Internal method to remove from a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: the new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.printTree(algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Internal method to print a subtree in sorted order.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.skew(algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Skew primitive for AA-trees.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: the new root after the rotation.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.split(algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Split primitive for AA-trees.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: the new root after the rotation.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.rotateWithLeftChild(algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with left child.

member.name: M:algorithms.AATree.rotateWithRightChild(algorithms.AANode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with right child.

member.name: T:algorithms.AvlTree
member.summary: Implements an AVL tree. Note that all "matching" is based on the compareTo method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss

member.name: P:algorithms.AvlTree.Empty
member.summary: Test if the tree is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.insert(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Insert into the tree; duplicates are ignored.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.remove(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Remove from the tree. Nothing is done if x is not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.findMin
member.summary: Find the smallest item in the tree.
member.returns: smallest item or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.findMax
member.summary: Find the largest item in the tree.
member.returns: the largest item of null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.find(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Find an item in the tree.
member.returns: the matching item or null if not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the tree logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.printTree
member.summary: Print the tree contents in sorted order.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.elementAt(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to get element field.
member.returns: the element field or null if t is null.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.insert(algorithms.Comparable,algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to insert into a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: the new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.findMin(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to find the smallest item in a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: node containing the smallest item.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.findMax(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to find the largest item in a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: node containing the largest item.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.find(algorithms.Comparable,algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to find an item in a subtree.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.
member.returns: node containing the matched item.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.printTree(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Internal method to print a subtree in sorted order.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.height(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Return the height of node t, or -1, if null.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.max(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return maximum of lhs and rhs.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.rotateWithLeftChild(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with left child. For AVL trees, this is a single rotation for case 1. Update heights, then return new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.rotateWithRightChild(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with right child. For AVL trees, this is a single rotation for case 4. Update heights, then return new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.doubleWithLeftChild(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Double rotate binary tree node: first left child with its right child; then node k3 with new left child. For AVL trees, this is a double rotation for case 2. Update heights, then return new root.

member.name: M:algorithms.AvlTree.doubleWithRightChild(algorithms.AvlNode)
member.summary: Double rotate binary tree node: first right child with its left child; then node k1 with new right child. For AVL trees, this is a double rotation for case 3. Update heights, then return new root.

member.name: F:algorithms.AvlTree.root
member.summary: The tree root.

member.name: T:algorithms.BinaryHeap

member.summary: Remove the smallest item from the priority queue.
member.returns: the smallest item, or null, if empty.

member.summary: Establish heap order property from an arbitrary arrangement of items. Runs in linear time.

member.summary: Make the priority queue logically empty.

member.summary: Internal method to percolate down in the heap.

member.name: T:algorithms.BinomialQueue
member.summary: Implements a binomial queue. Note that all "matching" is based on the compareTo method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: P:algorithms.BinomialQueue.Empty
member.summary: Test if the priority queue is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: P:algorithms.BinomialQueue.Full
member.summary: Test if the priority queue is logically full.
member.returns: true if full, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the binomial queue.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.merge(algorithms.BinomialQueue)
member.summary: Merge rhs into the priority queue. rhs becomes empty. rhs must be different from this.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.combineTrees(algorithms.BinomialNode,algorithms.BinomialNode)
member.summary: Return the result of merging equal-sized t1 and t2.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.insert(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Insert into the priority queue, maintaining heap order. This implementation is not optimized for O(1) performance.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.findMin
member.summary: Find the smallest item in the priority queue.
member.returns: the smallest item, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.findMinIndex
member.summary: Find index of tree containing the smallest item in the priority queue. The priority queue must not be empty.
member.returns: the index of tree containing the smallest item.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.deleteMin
member.summary: Remove the smallest item from the priority queue.
member.returns: the smallest item, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the priority queue logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.BinomialQueue.capacity
member.summary: Return the capacity.

member.summary: Protocol for Comparable objects. In Java 1.2, you can remove this file.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.summary: Compare this object with rhs.

member.name: T:algorithms.CursorList
member.summary: Linked list implementation of the list using a header node; cursor version. Access to the list is via CursorListItr.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: P:algorithms.CursorList.Empty
member.summary: Test if the list is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the list.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the list logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.zeroth
member.summary: Return an iterator representing the header node.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.first
member.summary: Return an iterator representing the first node in the list. This operation is valid for empty lists.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.insert(System.Object,algorithms.CursorListItr)
member.summary: Insert after p.
member.param: the position prior to the newly inserted item.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.find(System.Object)
member.summary: Return iterator corresponding to the first node containing an item.
member.returns: an iterator; iterator isPastEnd if item is not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.findPrevious(System.Object)
member.summary: Return iterator prior to the first node containing an item.
member.returns: appropriate iterator if the item is found. Otherwise, the iterator corresponding to the last element in the list is returned.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorList.remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Remove the first occurrence of an item.

member.name: T:algorithms.CursorListItr
member.summary: Linked list implementation of the list iterator using a header node; cursor version.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: P:algorithms.CursorListItr.PastEnd
member.summary: Test if the current position is past the end of the list.
member.returns: true if the current position is null-equivalent.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorListItr.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the list iterator
member.param: any node in the linked list.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorListItr.retrieve
member.summary: Return the item stored in the current position.
member.returns: the stored item or null if the current position is not in the list.

member.name: M:algorithms.CursorListItr.advance
member.summary: Advance the current position to the next node in the list. If the current position is null, then do nothing.

member.name: T:algorithms.DisjSets
member.summary: Disjoint set class. (Package friendly so not used accidentally) Does not use union heuristics or path compression. Elements in the set are numbered starting at 0.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathan Moore

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSets.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the disjoint sets object.
member.param: the initial number of disjoint sets.

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSets.union(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Union two disjoint sets. For simplicity, we assume root1 and root2 are distinct and represent set names.

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSets.find(System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform a find. Error checks omitted again for simplicity.
member.returns: the set containing x.

member.name: T:algorithms.DisjSetsFast
member.summary: Disjoint set class, using union by rank and path compression. Elements in the set are numbered starting at 0.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSetsFast.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the disjoint sets object.
member.param: the initial number of disjoint sets.

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSetsFast.union(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Union two disjoint sets using the height heuristic. For simplicity, we assume root1 and root2 are distinct and represent set names.

member.name: M:algorithms.DisjSetsFast.find(System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform a find with path compression. Error checks omitted again for simplicity.
member.returns: the set containing x.

member.name: T:algorithms.Hashable
member.summary: Protocol for Hashable objects.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: M:algorithms.Hashable.hash(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compute a hash function for this object.
member.returns: (deterministically) a number between 0 and tableSize-1, distributed equitably.

member.summary: Implements the toString method.
member.returns: the String representation.

member.summary: Implements the compareTo method.
member.exception: if rhs is not a MyInteger.

member.summary: Implements the equals method.
member.returns: true if the objects are equal, false otherwise.

member.name: T:algorithms.Overflow
member.summary: Exception class for access in full containers such as stacks, queues, and priority queues.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathan Moore

member.name: T:algorithms.PairHeap
member.summary: Implements a pairing heap. Supports a decreaseKey operation. Note that all "matching" is based on the compareTo method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathan moore

member.name: P:algorithms.PairHeap.Empty
member.summary: Test if the priority queue is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the pairing heap.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.insert(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Insert into the priority queue, and return a PairNode that can be used by decreaseKey. Duplicates are allowed.
member.returns: the node containing the newly inserted item.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.findMin
member.summary: Find the smallest item in the priority queue.
member.returns: the smallest item, or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.deleteMin
member.summary: Remove the smallest item from the priority queue.
member.returns: the smallest item, or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.decreaseKey(algorithms.PairNode,algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Change the value of the item stored in the pairing heap. Does nothing if newVal is larger than the currently stored value.
member.param: the new value, which must be smaller than the currently stored value.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the priority queue logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.compareAndLink(algorithms.PairNode,algorithms.PairNode)
member.summary: Internal method that is the basic operation to maintain order. Links first and second together to satisfy heap order.
member.param: root of tree 1, which may not be null. first.nextSibling MUST be null on entry.
root of tree 2, which may be null.
member.returns: result of the tree merge.

member.name: M:algorithms.PairHeap.combineSiblings(algorithms.PairNode)
member.summary: Internal method that implements two-pass merging.
member.param: the root of the conglomerate; assumed not null.

member.name: T:algorithms.PairNode
member.summary: Public class for use with PairHeap. It is public only to allow references to be sent to decreaseKey. It has no public methods or members.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss, Jonathan Moore

member.name: M:algorithms.PairNode.#ctor(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Construct the PairNode.
member.param: the value stored in the node.

member.name: T:algorithms.QueueAr
member.summary: Array-based implementation of the queue.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathn Moore

member.name: P:algorithms.QueueAr.Empty
member.summary: Test if the queue is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: P:algorithms.QueueAr.Full
member.summary: Test if the queue is logically full.
member.returns: true if full, false otherwise.

member.name: P:algorithms.QueueAr.Front
member.summary: Get the least recently inserted item in the queue. Does not alter the queue.
member.returns: the least recently inserted item in the queue, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the queue.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the queue.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the queue logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.dequeue
member.summary: Return and remove the least recently inserted item from the queue.
member.returns: the least recently inserted item in the queue, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.enqueue(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert a new item into the queue.

member.name: M:algorithms.QueueAr.increment(System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal method to increment with wraparound.
member.returns: x+1, or 0, if x is at the end of theArray.

member.name: M:algorithms.Rotations.withLeftChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with left child. For AVL trees, this is a single rotation for case 1.

member.name: M:algorithms.Rotations.withRightChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with right child. For AVL trees, this is a single rotation for case 4.

member.name: M:algorithms.Rotations.doubleWithLeftChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Double rotate binary tree node: first left child with its right child; then node k3 with new left child. For AVL trees, this is a double rotation for case 2.

member.name: M:algorithms.Rotations.doubleWithRightChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Double rotate binary tree node: first right child with its left child; then node k1 with new right child. For AVL trees, this is a double rotation for case 3.

member.name: T:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable
member.summary: Separate chaining table implementation of hash tables. Note that all "matching" is based on the equals method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathan Moore

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the hash table.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the hash table.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.insert(algorithms.Hashable)
member.summary: Insert into the hash table. If the item is already present, then do nothing.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.remove(algorithms.Hashable)
member.summary: Remove from the hash table.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.find(algorithms.Hashable)
member.summary: Find an item in the hash table.
member.returns: the matching item, or null if not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the hash table logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.hash(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: A hash routine for String objects.
member.param: the size of the hash table.
member.returns: the hash value.

member.name: F:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.theLists
member.summary: The array of Lists.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.nextPrime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal method to find a prime number at least as large as n.
member.returns: a prime number larger than or equal to n.

member.name: M:algorithms.SeparateChainingHashTable.isPrime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal method to test if a number is prime. Not an efficient algorithm.
member.returns: the result of the test.

member.name: T:algorithms.SplayTree
member.summary: Implements a top-down splay tree. Note that all "matching" is based on the compareTo method.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss

member.name: P:algorithms.SplayTree.Empty
member.summary: Test if the tree is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.insert(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Insert into the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.remove(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Remove from the tree.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.findMin
member.summary: Find the smallest item in the tree. Not the most efficient implementation (uses two passes), but has correct amortized behavior. A good alternative is to first call Find with parameter smaller than any item in the tree, then call findMin.
member.returns: the smallest item or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.findMax
member.summary: Find the largest item in the tree. Not the most efficient implementation (uses two passes), but has correct amortized behavior. A good alternative is to first call Find with parameter larger than any item in the tree, then call findMax.
member.returns: the largest item or null if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.find(algorithms.Comparable)
member.summary: Find an item in the tree.
member.returns: the matching item or null if not found.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the tree logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.printTree
member.summary: Print the tree contents in sorted order.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.splay(algorithms.Comparable,algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Internal method to perform a top-down splay. The last accessed node becomes the new root.
member.param: the target item to splay around.
the root of the subtree to splay.
member.returns: the subtree after the splay.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.rotateWithLeftChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with left child.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.rotateWithRightChild(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Rotate binary tree node with right child.

member.name: M:algorithms.SplayTree.printTree(algorithms.BinaryNode)
member.summary: Internal method to print a subtree in sorted order. WARNING: This is prone to running out of stack space.
member.param: the node that roots the tree.

member.name: T:algorithms.StackAr
member.summary: Array-based implementation of the stack.
member.author: Mark Allen Weiss Jonathan Moore

member.name: P:algorithms.StackAr.Empty
member.summary: Test if the stack is logically empty.
member.returns: true if empty, false otherwise.

member.name: P:algorithms.StackAr.Full
member.summary: Test if the stack is logically full.
member.returns: true if full, false otherwise.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.#ctor
member.summary: Construct the stack.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Construct the stack.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.makeEmpty
member.summary: Make the stack logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.top
member.summary: Get the most recently inserted item in the stack. Does not alter the stack.
member.returns: the most recently inserted item in the stack, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.pop
member.summary: Remove the most recently inserted item from the stack.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.push(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert a new item into the stack, if not already full.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackAr.topAndPop
member.summary: Return and remove most recently inserted item from the stack.
member.returns: most recently inserted item, or null, if stack is empty.

member.summary: Test if the stack is logically empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackLi.#ctor

member.summary: Get the most recently inserted item in the stack. Does not alter the stack.
member.returns: the most recently inserted item in the stack, or null, if empty.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackLi.pop
member.summary: Remove the most recently inserted item from the stack.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackLi.topAndPop
member.summary: Return and remove the most recently inserted item from the stack.

member.name: M:algorithms.StackLi.push(System.Object)
member.summary: Insert a new item into the stack.

member.name: T:LSCollections.SkipList
member.summary: Represents a collection of key-and-value pairs.
member.remarks: The SkipList class is an implementation of the IDictionary interface. It is based on the data structure created by William Pugh.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SkipList class that is empty and is sorted according to the IComparable interface implemented by each key added to the SkipList.
member.remarks: Each key must implement the IComparable interface to be capable of comparisons with every other key in the SortedList. The elements are sorted according to the IComparable implementation of each key added to the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.#ctor(System.Collections.IComparer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SkipList class that is empty and is sorted according to the specified IComparer interface.
member.param: The IComparer implementation to use when comparing keys.
member.remarks: The elements are sorted according to the specified IComparer implementation. If comparer is a null reference, the IComparable implementation of each key is used; therefore, each key must implement the IComparable interface to be capable of comparisons with every other key in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.GetNewLevel
member.summary: Returns a level value for a new SkipList node.
member.returns: The level value for a new SkipList node.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Search(System.Object)
member.summary: Searches for the specified key.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Search(System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node@)
member.summary: Searches for the specified key.
member.param: A SkipList node to hold the results of the search.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Search(System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node[])
member.summary: Searches for the specified key.
member.param: An array of nodes holding references to the places in the SkipList search in which the search dropped down one level.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Search(System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node@,LSCollections.SkipList.Node[])
member.summary: Searches for the specified key.
member.param: A SkipList node to hold the results of the search.
An array of nodes holding references to the places in the SkipList search in which the search dropped down one level.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.SearchWithComparer(System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node@,LSCollections.SkipList.Node[])
member.summary: Search for the specified key using a comparer.
member.param: A SkipList node to hold the results of the search.
An array of nodes holding references to the places in the SkipList search in which the search dropped down one level.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.SearchWithComparable(System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node@,LSCollections.SkipList.Node[])
member.summary: Search for the specified key using the IComparable interface implemented by each key.
member.param: A SkipList node to hold the results of the search.
An array of nodes holding references to the places in the SkipList search in which the search dropped down one level.
member.returns: Returns true if the specified key is in the SkipList.
member.remarks:
Assumes each key inserted into the SkipList implements the IComparable interface.
If the specified key is in the SkipList, the curr parameter will reference the node with the key. If the specified key is not in the SkipList, the curr paramater will either hold the node with the first key value greater than the specified key or null indicating that the search reached the end of the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Insert(System.Object,System.Object,LSCollections.SkipList.Node[])
member.summary: Inserts a key/value pair into the SkipList.
member.param: The key to insert into the SkipList.
The value to insert into the SkipList.
An array of nodes holding references to places in the SkipList in which the search for the place to insert the new key/value pair dropped down one level.

member.name: T:LSCollections.SkipList.Node
member.summary: Represents a node in the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Node.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instant of a Node with its node level.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Node.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes an instant of a Node with its node level and key/value pair.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Node.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the Node.

member.name: T:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator
member.summary: Enumerates the elements of a skip list.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of a SkipListEnumerator.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.Entry
member.summary: Gets both the key and the value of the current dictionary entry.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.Key
member.summary: Gets the key of the current dictionary entry.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the current dictionary entry.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the skip list.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the skip list.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the skip list.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.SkipListEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element in the skip list.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Add(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an element with the provided key and value to the SkipList.
member.param: The Object to use as the key of the element to add.
The Object to use as the value of the element to add.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the SkipList contains an element with the specified key.
member.param: The key to locate in the SkipList.
member.returns: true if the SkipList contains an element with the key; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an IDictionaryEnumerator for the SkipList.
member.returns: An IDictionaryEnumerator for the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the element with the specified key from the SkipList.
member.param: The key of the element to remove.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.IsFixedSize
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the SkipList has a fixed size.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the IDictionary is read-only.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets or sets the element with the specified key. This is the indexer for the SkipList.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.Keys
member.summary: Gets an ICollection containing the keys of the SkipList.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.Values
member.summary: Gets an ICollection containing the values of the SkipList.

member.name: M:LSCollections.SkipList.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the elements of the SkipList to an Array, starting at a particular Array index.
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from SkipList.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the SkipList.

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.IsSynchronized
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the SkipList is synchronized (thread-safe).

member.name: P:LSCollections.SkipList.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the SkipList.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the SkipList.
